text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse has a diverse and fragmented customer base; no single customer represents more than 10% of sales
text_1_evidence: "no customer represents more than 10% of sales"
text_2_claim_summary: No single customer accounted for more than 10% of net sales; top distributor accounted for ~11%
text_2_evidence: "Sales to Arrow Electronics ... were 11.2%, 11.5% and 10.7% of consolidated net sales in 2023, 2022 and 2021, respectively. No other single customer accounted for more than 10% of net sales."

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse’s geographic reach is balanced, with roughly one-third of sales each in the Americas, Asia-Pacific and Europe (shipped-to basis)
text_1_evidence: "38% of sales in North America, 38% Asia Pacific and 24% Europe"
"geographical exposures are on a shipped-to basis"
text_2_claim_summary: Shipped-to net sales by region match: ~38% Americas, ~38% Asia-Pacific, ~24% Europe in 2023
text_2_evidence: "Net sales in the Americas... $901.5 (38%); Asia-Pacific $898.9 (38%); Europe $562.3 (24%) of total $2,362.7 million in 2023."

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse’s broad product portfolio and cumulative expertise create a durable competitive moat
text_1_evidence: "difficult to replicate the huge assortment of solutions"
"cumulative learning that is very difficult to replicate"
text_2_claim_summary: Littelfuse reports one of the broadest product portfolios in the industry, competing on breadth, innovation and reliability
text_2_evidence: "Electronics Segment consists of one of the broadest product offerings in the industry..."
"The Company believes that it globally competes on the basis of innovative products, the breadth of its product line, the quality..."

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse is well positioned to benefit from secular electrification trends across end markets (eMobility, renewables, data centers, factory automation)
text_1_evidence: "just looking at end markets: energy storage, renewable energy, data centres, factory automation, EV charging infrastructure, etc."
text_2_claim_summary: Company strategy targets sustainability, connectivity and safety driving demand in electrification, EV charging, renewables, data center
text_2_evidence: "The Company is well-positioned within the center of the global structural growth themes of sustainability, connectivity and safety"
"product demand is driven by ongoing electronification and electrification of applications... renewables, energy storage, EV charging infrastructure, data centers"

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse’s business is not capital-intensive: capex is only 4–5% of sales
text_1_evidence: "Littelfuse is not a capital intensive business, requiring only 4–5% of sales in capex"
text_2_claim_summary: In 2023 capex of $86.2 million represented under 4% of net sales
text_2_evidence: "Purchases of property, plant, and equipment ... $86.2 million"
"Net sales were $2,362.7 million...capital expenditures were $86.2 million"

text_1_claim_summary: Company’s M&A strategy is funded by free cash flow and conservative use of debt with minimal impact on share count
text_1_evidence: "Littelfuse has acquired ... all financed by internal cash generation and debt levels have barely budged"
text_2_claim_summary: Acquisitions funded with cash on hand and well-controlled debt; net debt/EBITDA ~1.3×; no share issuances
text_2_evidence: "Western Automation ... financed with cash on hand"
"C&K ... financed through a combination of cash on hand and debt"

text_1_claim_summary: Operating margins are not Littelfuse’s highest priority, with target operating margins of 17–19%; little room for margin expansion
text_1_evidence: "Littelfuse is not a big margin expansion story"
text_2_claim_summary: 2023 operating margin was ~15.3%, down from ~19.9% in 2022, reflecting focus on growth over margin expansion
text_2_evidence: "Operating income for 2023 was $360.9 million... Operating margins decreased from 19.9% in 2022 to 15.3% in 2023"
